caption: Quite disappointed on their communication. The phone they just disconnected so noone bothers. Instagram message responds to tell you I am not writing here, only on email. Same person, same keyboard - rude. Also I sent like 20 questions would be a lot easier on phone but they outright refuse. Real disappointment.

It's a shame I have to write this review since I really enjoy going to this beautiful school in the Bois de Vincennes and there are many nice people who work there... but, the course that I am enrolled in is truly terrible and I definitely will not be returning next trimester.  Seven weeks ago I started the course hoping to advance significantly on the skills I had learnt (trot, canter, changing the rein, four loop serpentine, etc) during two weeks of private lessons in Mustique. It has proven completely impossible as administration at the Centre Bayard UCPA insisted that I should be in the complete beginners class since I did not yet know how to prepare my horse (this is a truly basic skill I could have acquired in 30 minutes and honed in a few weeks).  We have changed instructors three times over a period of seven weeks, so as soon as you get used to one, they're gone.  For the first month all we essentially did was brush and prepare our horses, take them into the arena and mount them, and then the class was finished. I went away for two weeks, and on my return, we took the horses for a gentle walk in the Bois de Vincennes. There had been no progression to trot or canter coming up to the two month mark. This seems crazy to me, it's like they want to students down for as long as possible.  There are more criticisms about the course but I will leave it there.  I am also enrolled in a beginner course at TCF in the Bois de Boulogne which is just amazing. As an indication of the difference in quality of these two establishments - at TCF in the first week we were trotting, the second week we were cantering, the seventh week we were testing our skills in a competition style class.  I'll be sad not to return to this beautiful location but I'm better off spending my money elsewhere.
Horse riding training school, free entry to public.
Nice place for that love nature and animals (and not just horses).
This is the place where I go everytime that I want to go see horses for free :) Quite a nice place for all the horses addict.
Really a good one to learn ..

Rider for 5 years in this center, the quality of support and facilities is constantly improving.  The horses and ponies are also very well looked after given the location of the equestrian center.  I highly recommend this place if you like horses and nature.

My daughter loves this equestrian center She has already done 2 courses and LOVES the Sunday afternoon meetings for 4/6 year olds. Today thanks to the good weather we took a nice walk in the woods ü§© The setting of this equestrian center is superb and the instructors are great! July 2024 update: Another internship for my 7 year old daughter (with her big brother (him 2nd internship)) Superb week Lou instructor at the top! The children loved the course and are already waiting for the next one! They were also THRILLED to find Safia who assists the instructor and manages the children during the lunch break. She adapts the break according to the children's state of fatigue (quiet time reading, rest, games, etc.) many thanks!

I was honestly skeptical when signing my daughter up for riding lessons, given the comments I had heard. However, I wanted to experience it for myself. My daughter started riding this year in a discovery class, and these lessons have become the weekly meeting she adores and longs for. I'm not pretending that it has always been easy, and that's normal, because it's a sport that requires adaptation with an animal, which is not trivial. Feeling the animal, talking to it, stroking it, preparing it, brushing it: this approach is so essential. In addition, my daughter has had a few falls, three or four during the year, but each time, nothing serious. The teachers always took care to review with the pony why and how the incident occurred. My daughter learned to get up after falls, which built her character. In addition, I notice that the children help each other enormously; there is real solidarity between them. Riding a horse is not easy, it is a sport that involves risks, and falls are part of the learning process. This sport has allowed my daughter to gain self-confidence and by learning to interact with the horse and to master the different stages of preparation before riding, she develops her sense of responsibility and her ability to take initiatives, thus strengthening his autonomy and just for all that, I validate, and we will continue the riding lessons next year.

I did an internship recently and it was just perfect! I was made very welcome and the instructors were excellent throughout the week üëåüèª The place is really magnificent and the bar/restaurant part is also very good. Simple and effective üç¥ ‚Ä¶
Great Club, the instructors are great. Special mention for Manel who always has a beautiful smile!

I am sharing the experience that my daughter Lucie had last summer during a one-week internship. How can we leave children without experience for their first time on a pony without an adult or a competent person? At any time a pony can gallop... After a second experience in a center in the countryside near Chartres I realized this negligence, my daughter constantly had an older student near her to ensure that the animal did not appear and to guide her. Beyond the fact that the child could fall, it is also his self-confidence that is at stake. My daughter was dreading starting a new internship and this new experience reassured her. You don't put a person behind the wheel of a car without being guided by an instructor, it would be good to do the same, it actually requires staff or volunteers but it is important to do things well. I do not recommend if your child has no experience

The course went very well as it does every school holiday, the instructors took great care of the children. My 5 and 4 year old daughters loved it and we intend to re-enroll them for the next holiday. I highly recommend.

I did an internship and I loved everyone and the welcoming ponies are just great the instructors are really educational it really allows you to evolve there is a good atmosphere I will come back! thank you again to the whole team for this internship

Balance Level Rider (Gallop 1) - Horse Section:  The observation - 12 horses in a single file line in a riding school that is too small  - Instructors (not all) who lack rigor and pedagogy to acquire the skills required for Galop 1  - not enough horses for beginners  Currently it is not a club for beginners but for riders of confirmed Galop 3 level and above.  - there are 10 horses for beginners (gallop 1 and 2) compared to 60 intermediate and confirmed horses (gallop 3 to 7)  - most instructors no longer know and no longer really want to teach Canter 1 and 2.  THE WISH:  - no more lessons but strictly limited to 8 riders given the surface area of ‚Äã‚Äãthe rides  - more horses for beginners  - instructors who have the skills and taste to teach beginners  üôèü§ûüèª
Great welcome. Professionalism on point. The idyllic setting for a unique equine experience. We will come back. Little extra, delicious cuisine!

A good place to train and where you can progress.  You quickly become independent as long as you have a really good foundation to start with (learning how to approach a horse in the box, knowing how to put on a halter, the reins and their precise location, at least knowing the walk, mastering a little trim and balance, etc.). ...).  For this nothing will be worth a series of private lessons, here or elsewhere!!! The real good starting point is a trainer who will follow you for a short period at least. Before finding ourselves in a group where we will mainly do practice...but in a group. Otherwise, the equipment is of good quality in general and the instructors are quite attentive, some of them are excellent. Large careers and rides are available for training. A place that attracts a lot of people, sometimes too many.  The atmosphere (too much traffic, external visitors wandering everywhere putting employees' nerves on edge) can be felt and tensions can build or even explode (service at the bar for example) and become completely unbearable. Despite everything, quite good memories and real moments of freedom with these very often incredibly endearing athletes who we serve above all - the horses, and around whom everything should revolve. You might as well stop by to get an idea and ask for a trial lesson. We would advise getting closer to truly incredible instructors like Sylvie or Isabelle (thanks to them for what they have taught me over these long years).

The poor ponies are crammed into inappropriate boxes...during lessons they are whipped by the children in front of the instructors who say nothing.....it's shameful, the needs of the horses as well as the ponies are non-existent.  It's a money machine.
Quality equestrian center, my daughter is happy to be able to ride very well trained ponies. Very welcoming and professional staff...

A very good equestrian center, friendly, with good horses, well equipped and without snobbery because it is financially accessible. The center being in Paris, in the Bois de Vincennes, the horses have little opportunity to go out to graze freely.

‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è  An exceptional experience at the Bayard UCPA Vincennes equestrian center! The facilities are impeccable and well maintained, providing an ideal setting for riders of all levels. The instructors are passionate, professional and very attentive, making each lesson informative and pleasant. The horses are well cared for and suitable for riders, whether you are a beginner or an experienced rider. Special mention for the friendly and warm atmosphere that reigns within the center. I highly recommend this place to everyone!!

A horse riding club to avoid! On August 18, 2023, I decided to get back on horseback after 25 years without equestrian activity. As soon as I got on the horse, I fell twice in 15 minutes, the first time on my head and the second on my knee. Why did this Club give me this horse known to be nervous? (A rider who was riding with me that day admitted to me that she was surprised that I was given this horse). The instructor (Laura), cold and aggressive, forced me to get back on after my first fall, without even asking my opinion, as well as the second time by changing horses. She never called me to find out how I was doing, the Club showed no empathy and took 9 months to complete its insurance certificate, thus preventing me from being taken care of quickly. of my health costs (more than 3000 euros). This is why, last February, I went to see the director of the club to understand why he was not responding to my insurer and the latter told me that in fact, Laura was very strange and had gone to the improvised without returning the keys...However, 2 months later, he denied the facts and told the insurance company a completely different story. I had knee surgery, and today, after a year of intense physiotherapy, I have my neck and my knee back, what luck! But I'm still afraid of hurting myself, as if I had taken 10 years. And above all, I am afraid of getting back on horseback, having loved it throughout my youth.

Very nice course, my daughter did it for the first time at 6.5 years old and she really loved it! She is only waiting for one thing: the next internship! A big thank you to Dimitri and the whole team!

I've been coming to this club since I was 4 years old (I've been there for 10 years) and there's nothing to say about the instructors I've had throughout these years who have given me a lot of help even if I I had an inexperienced instructor, the others are very good! In short, it's a great club where we progress quite quickly for my part and the supervision is quite good.

Really hazardous and very disappointing communication from UCPA. We were at the association forum in St Mand√©, with people from the UCPA who give slots and places which do not exist once you call the center. And if there is a strong demand for pony riding why not increase the slots. In short, really strange management and communication.
I've been riding there for a long time now, it's really a great club with exceptional instructors who are always there to help and support these riders.

It's a great club where you progress quickly if you put your mind to it, the teachers are all kind and attentive and the horses are brown, treated and happy, some have a big character but horse riding is a sport where it You need to know how to ride all types of horses. After 1 year there I don't regret my registration!!!

Unmissable and easy walk. Discover a large equestrian club and pony club while walking in the Bois de Vincennes in Paris. Bar, snack, open to the public (except in August) metro chateau de vincennes or porte de vincennes line 1 or porte doree line 8, 1 hour nice walk. Paris is so nice!

We have just completed a one-week course with Arthur. It was great. This allowed us to understand a lot of things. Arthur was great on an educational and technical level and also on a human level. Well done

Perfect internship, Dimitri is very professional, kind and attentive with the children! A caring teacher that children love! A big thank you for this enchanted parenthesis To do again very quickly Lucie Bonnetain

Very professional equestrian center. My discovery class with Mr. Jean-Christophe was a great experience! I would like to thank him and also thank Safia who was my guide. She made me want to discover the world of horse riding :)
An equestrian center with a team of dedicated, passionate and educational instructors. The setting is very pleasant, guaranteeing an enriching experience!
Very good course with a great instructor. My daughter is as always delighted to have done an internship in this equestrian center.
A magical, magnificent equestrian center Where you can meet lots of superb people The team is incredible And attentive I highly recommend the equestrian center
One-week summer course, a great first experience for my 7-year-old daughter, who now wants to enroll for the year! Highly recommended course

I strongly recommend this equestrian center, the instructors are attentive to the needs of the ponies/horses as well as the riders. This center has a multitude of ponies/horses, which allows you to improve. This equestrian center has a cafeteria. But above all, this equestrian center has a lot of space to learn about the world of horse riding. So I strongly advise you

Rereading certain comments years after going up to Bayard I feel the need to share my experience. I was quite young at the time and less attentive to horse signals. With my current perspective and the evolution of my conception of horse riding, I am shocked by the state of mental health of most of the horses that I have been able to ride. Each horse is reined with elastics or hunting collars (at least this was the case between 2015 and 2018) we wonder why if not to constrain them. This shows the lack of consideration of the individuality of each animal. These are supposed to have specially adapted equipment. Some are very aggressive and suspicious when boxing, others when riding. They live in cubicles and spend hours of classes. I particularly remember an aberrant experience that could have been dramatic. I was riding a chestnut whose name escapes me in a quarry located at the edge of an athletics field, we could hear whistles and shouts from ball players, which greatly stressed the horses. Mine in particular got carried away 4 times during the session. It was sporty but these are the risks of the practice, the horse was very very very little desensitized and therefore dangerous but hey at least it was in the quarry he could not go very far... On the other hand during the micro walk back (in the Bois de Vincennes), my horse and others in the group got carried away because of a bike. I was taken on board at crazy speed, impossible to stop unlike the others. My horse crossed a road, reared up, a car swerved to avoid us and I let myself fall, he was caught further away by p√©tanque players.  It is absolutely unconscious to put young riders on horses who panic at the slightest movement around them and who are clearly far from feeling well in their heads.  This establishment is a business with little concern for animal welfare, despite what it strives to try to prove. I don't even understand how places like that attract so many riders. This is a factory to absolutely avoid.

My 6 year old daughter has just completed an internship at this center. It was really great. The instructors are very involved. They love children and are really very educational. She had an unforgettable week. The center is magnificent with its Club House at extremely affordable prices and open to walkers. The terrace is magnificent and super pleasant. The horses are very well looked after. In short: happiness in the heart of Paris! I will try to register it for the year. Because this is the only downside: the courses are in high demand...
